attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Hold a Northern Ireland referendum on whether to Remain in the EU Customs Union
attributes.background: Northern Ireland voted by a significant majority to Remain in the EU and will be one of the regions most significantly affected by withdrawal. As Sinn Fein do not take up their seats in Parliament, it would be good to go directly to the NI electorate for their views on this proposal.

attributes.action: Stop 'Treatment Without Consent' in the Mental Health Act
attributes.background: If patients with physical illnesses such as cancer can refuse treatment mental health patients should also be able to do the same. The current practice of using the Mental Health Act to force treatment is coercive and a violation of the autonomy of the patient.
attributes.additional_details: The current practice of psychiatry is almost exclusively based on a biochemical model. The outcome of this is that medication is seen as the only credible resort when treating patients suffering from psychotic illness. When patients suffer side effects they are seen as non-compliant and when they stop medication they are placed on CTOs. This violates the patient's autonomy to make decisions for themselves about their treatment.

attributes.action: Reduce preventable negligence cases within the NHS
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are being let down by avoidable errors made by the NHS. Errors such as failing to provide emergency care, mistakes in dispensing the correct drugs and dosages, misdiagnosis, delays in treatment, and incorrect treatment. This is harming patients and causing unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last decade, negligence claims against the NHS have quadrupled to an annual payout of £1.7 billion. This is set to double by 2021. This suggests a growing problem that isn't being dealt with effectively. Health leaders propose to address this issue by capping the amount of compensation that is paid out to victims. Yet this won't reduce the number of negligence cases. We need to invest more resources into identifying the root causes of the problem and in turn implementing a solution.

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Allow IVF medication to be donated or sold through appropriate channels.
attributes.background: IVF medication is extremely expensive and is very often left over in large quantities due to miscalculation or like in my case because the treatment didn’t work. I have £800 worth of perfectly good medication (non-refrigerated) and my only option is, incredibly, to DISPOSE OF IT.
attributes.additional_details:
I contacted charities and IVF support groups and found that it’s actually illegal under the Medicines Act and the Drug trafficking Act to give them to someone else. 

IVF clinics or infertility charities should be allowed to redistribute the medication, helping families that cannot afford the drugs.

attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: Make it illegal to burn state flags of all countries.
attributes.background: As we all know the UK is a very diverse and multicultural place especially London. For this reason, many people from different ethnics are united by flags that represent them. We must make it illegal to burn flags to decrease growing hate of different ethnics towards each other. eg Turks vs Kurds.

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher maths papers and make one whole paper for everyone.
attributes.background: As everyone knows, there is higher and foundation maths. Foundation is for those who aren't as able at Maths but sometimes people are wrongly placed there. Make one whole paper for everyone, you never know what people could achieve. It would be fair to everyone if we all do the higher paper.
attributes.additional_details: The highest grade you can get for Foundation maths is C and it's known that its much easier to get a C in higher. Most people in foundation maths could easily get a 8 or a 9 (A's). The paper should be equal.

attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Demonstrate how more disabled people in the workforce has impacted productivity.
attributes.background: On the 6/12/17, whilst giving evidence to the commons Treasury Select committee, Phillip Hammond stated that "It is almost certainly the case that...very high levels of engagement in the workforce, for example of disabled people...may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements.
attributes.additional_details:
For a full transcript, follow the link

http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/treasury-committee/budget-autumn-2017/oral/75188.html

attributes.action: Make sure we get a Brexit Deal.
attributes.background: If Brexit didn't have a deal, it would be chaos for us. If we can't get a  deal, we're on our own, and we'll have to rely on other countries to give us power and maybe being the end of the UK altogether. So there must be a Brexit deal, or we're in anarchy.

attributes.action: Introduce a national agency to perform detailed 'anti-money laundering' testing
attributes.background:
Anti money laundering (AML) checks are required by banks, and also legal advisers, accountants etc
Given a desire to reduce the UK as a destination for 'dirty money' rules could be tighter
AML checks are hard to carry out meaningfully and are already time consuming
attributes.additional_details:
A single agency could improve on the status quo by:
- removing duplication
- unbiased approach
- removing competitive pressures to cut rigour ('all our other [x] accepted this, why don't you?')
- speeding up transactions by pre-approval
- ability to see full picture of all UK investments when testing source of funds

Scheme could be self-funding by charging fees

Data security:
- replace info being gathered and held by multiple parties
- no need to disclose full details when issuing certificate

attributes.action: Protect against big business interests with a “People’s” lobby group fund
attributes.background: The government should change the law to impose a 10% tax on all payments to lobbying organisations.  The tax receipts could be used to establish and fund a public taxpayer interest group which would review all lobbying activities and participate and publicly report on each policy decision change.
attributes.additional_details:
The democratic system is systematically undermined every day by individuals, corporations and organizations who act to influence the actions, policies and decisions of government officers on their own behalf or for a selected group’s personal advantage or gain to the exclusion of the majority.

It is important for government officials and MPs serve the public interest first and not get mislead by lobbying parties or advisors who inadvertently act in a lobbying capacity.

attributes.action: Ban hunting for pheasants and other game birds. It is very cruel.
attributes.background: Hunting pheasants is just as bad as fox hunting in my opinion. This is a very very cruel sport. The poor birds are treated very badly and this needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: There are many videos on YouTube which show how these poor birds suffer. Why? All for the entertainment of huntsmen. How would they feel? To be shot and left for dead?

attributes.action: Lower the cost of taking the Practical driving test.
attributes.background: Every year roughly 850,000 driving tests are conducted but only 47-50% pass. That means one in two tests taken leads to a fail. Although the tests are getting harder, the price of it still remains incredibly high at £62.00. Driving should be a fun and educational life skill not a burden.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Roughly 850,000 driving tests are taken every year in the UK.
2. Only 47-50% pass the test.
3. Tests are getting harder but price is still sky high at £62.00.
4. If you are using your instructors vehicle the cost may increase even more.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Make Letting Fees illegal in England, like they are in Scotland
attributes.background: The fees letting agents charge have gotten out of hand, you can lay out a lot of hard cash, and lose it if you fail the reference, credit, or guarantor, stages of applying for a Tenancy, the cost of the Tenancy itself can be ridiculous, it's illegal in Scotland, why not in England?
attributes.additional_details:
I'm looking to move from my present address, (I have social housing) boy was I shocked, when I saw the cost of fees involved in doing so in the private sector. Fees have been illegal in Scotland since 2012, so why is it not the same in England? 
Is it because so many MP's are Landlords (123 was the count in 2017). They won't want to pick up the tab themselves, like they have to in Scotland for these checks, let's force their hand.

attributes.action: Increase British military spending to £65 Billion
attributes.background: The UK’s military spending is way to low with the threats in N.Korea, Syria and Russia we need to increase spending please sign this petition to increase military spending

attributes.action: Force all shops regardless of size to close on Christmas Day and Easter Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should force all shops regardless of size to close on Christmas and Easter Sunday because these days are special times for families to get together and these days should be different to all the other days in the year because people have all the time in the world to shop.

attributes.action: By law all Emergency Services Persons to be served before members of public
attributes.background: To make it compulsary by law that all on duty uniformed emergency services personnel are served at the front of ques in retail and food outlets to speed up the effieciency and working environments thus improving our response times and quality of staff

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Set out a date for the introduction of care home fees cap.
attributes.background: The Government has been making false promises to put a limit on care home fees since 2011. Last election, the Government promised in its lying manifesto to introduce a cap.
attributes.additional_details: People like me and my family that have worked hard bought our own homes and have been  "prudent with our money," have not been "rewarded" as the Government promised.

attributes.action: Companies to accept all holiday requests from families during school holidays.
attributes.background: For those being told that they can’t have a certain week off and then left to find AND PAY for childcare because their existing provider is closed! Leaving them to give their child to a stranger which is expensive and potentially puts them at risk. All requests to be accepted even if they overlap
attributes.additional_details: I propose we make it legal that if you have 1 or more children under 16 and you request a week off during the school holidays to cover childcare, your company cannot refuse. Currently each company have their own rules around staffing, 1 person off at a time for example. Meaning you need to find a stranger to watch your child and pay for the risky privilege. Companies refuse to pay for cover for that week and we lose out. It helps families financially in a big big way and also stops worry.

attributes.action: Cap the price of private and university owned student accommodation
attributes.background: Students are becoming more ripped off by the price of student accommodation each year thus becoming harder to live. It is already unfair that Student Finance dictate our maintenance loan based on our household income and the majority have to live in a student overdraft. We want fair reduced prices.

attributes.action: large vehicle awareness a mandatory part of obtaining a small vehicle licence
attributes.background: I feel that not enough people driving small vehicles are educated about the dangers of sharing the road with Heavy goods vehicles, Dangerous goods and long loads pose a threat to life if the proper information hasn't been given to all including those who are simply sharing the road.
attributes.additional_details: All I am asking is for people to be taught about what the signs mean on trucks that are designed to warn other road users of the dangers the vehicle poses. And for potential car licence holders to be educated on stopping times and blind spots of different vehicles. 75% of accidents between HGVs and cars are the car drivers fault and being given more awareness as part of a small vehicle licence could drastically improve those figures and even save lives!

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.

attributes.action: Increase the expenditure of money on prisons.
attributes.background: The prison system hasn't been correctly funded or managed for years. We propose that the government spends more of its expenditure on the prison system to increase capacity and pursue its purpose.

attributes.action: Charge a set £5 fee for every use of the NHS (i.e. GPs, ambulance or hospital)
attributes.background: Although we pay a contribution toward the NHS from our wages I feel there should also be a set fee.  We pay for home and motor insurance that we may never use, and when we do we pay an excess.  I feel the NHS should be no different.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is a great service, but society has changed considerably in the 70 years since its inception and the way the NHS is funded should be changed to reflect this.

attributes.action: A call for Highways England to make more sections of the M5 a smart motorway
attributes.background: Somerset Chamber of Commerce has long campaigned for better road infrastructure. The M5 is one of two main arterial routes into the South West. Frequently, the M5 between Gloucester and Exeter is affected by either full or partial closures affecting productivity, lost opportunity and serious injury.
attributes.additional_details: Following a freedom of information request to Highways England, it was confirmed that from 01/09/15 to 01/09/16 there were 16,934 incidents recorded on the M5 between Exeter & Gloucester, of which 3,547 resulted in full or partial closure, equating to an average of 10 accidents per day. The smart M42 motorway has resulted in no fatalities, reduced injury accidents by over 50%, and journey reliability improving by 22% since 2006, delivering major socio-economic benefits which could be replicated.

attributes.action: I believe that every adult in the UK should pay £10 a month to the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been admitted into hospital twice in 5 years for 2 major life changing operations. I noticed how loving and caring the porters, nurses, doctors and surgeons all were. I was very shocked to see that they work 12+ hours a day, clean, cook, pay for parking and bring their own food.
attributes.additional_details: I would rather spend my £13.12 (which I have to pay every month for my BBC TV LICENCE) on the NHS. It should be compulsory!

attributes.action: Standardise the tax rates for employment income with all other income sources
attributes.background:
If you receive most income from your employment, there is a 99% chance that you are probably ‘poor’ or, at least, not part of the 1% high wealth individuals.
The wealthy avoid high employment income tax rates and instead exploit generous allowances and lower tax rates on all other forms of income.
attributes.additional_details:
By standardising the tax rates on all forms of income, employment tax rates will fall since the disproportionate tax benefits available to the super-rich only will be reduced to create a fair tax system.

All income say, under £1m, including receipts from loans from non-UK sources and gains from share schemes, should be treated equally for tax purposes and thereafter a minimum tax rate of 10% should cap any excessive tax breaks. 
Personal allowance and capital gain exemption could also be combined.

attributes.action: Ratify Kampala amendments, give ICC jurisdiction over UK for crime of aggression
attributes.background:
The International Criminal Court, through the Kampala amendments (2010), is gaining jurisdiction over the crime of aggression on 17 July 2018, for those states that have ratified the amendments.

The UK, having pushed for this for decades, must ratify.
